titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5501) to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2009 through 2013 to provide assistance to foreign countries to combat HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis, and malaria, and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5501) to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2009 through 2013 to provide assistance to foreign countries to combat HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis, and malaria, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-562, by Mr. McGovern.
All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived except those arising under clause 9 or 10 of rule XXI.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 198.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1065.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 215 - 199 (Roll no. 154).

vote.text: Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 221 - 192 (Roll no. 155).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 221 - 192 (Roll no. 155).

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 5501 (Tom Lantos and Henry J. Hyde United States Global Leadership Against HIV/AIDS, Tuberculosis, and Malaria Reauthorization Act of 2008).
